projectTitle: Pigtails #1: A Martial Arts, Action Comic
projectDescription:
Pigtails is a martial arts, action-adventure starring Soo-jin Kang, a 22-year-old Korean woman starting a career in Chicago. Her story of love, loss, and redemption in this first issue will be told in black-and-white across 22 pages. 

  

I wrote the 3-issue series based on an idea my wife had, and this Kickstarter is to help get the first issue printed (with 2 variant covers) and provide some compensation to the AMAZING artist, Ming Wang. Besides the interior art, he also did the 2 black-and-white covers! Ming’s ability to convey deep emotion with simple techniques convinced me he was perfect to illustrate Soo-jin’s journey without needing color.  

I’ve also teamed up with the wonderful artist Janet Lee (Lost Vegas, Return of the Dapper Men, various Marvel comics) to provide a fun variant cover! I’ve followed her work for a number of years and knew she could deliver a variant to fit the theme and atmosphere of Pigtails.

 

 

WHAT'S DONE, WHAT'S TO COME

Issue #1 is completed, along with Ming’s variant covers. Janet’s cover will be revealed during the campaign’s first week. That means, of course, you’ll get everything in your hands much sooner without waiting for the main art to be completed! When the Kickstarter finishes, the pages will be sent to the printer. On average, it takes 2-3 weeks to receive the comics, but because I’m initially printing much more than my last Kickstarter (Lilacs) and having quantities of two variant issues, it will take at most another week or so. But that’s not bad at all! I choose a September delivery date to be safe, to allow a comfortable cushion. Based on my experiences with my previous Kickstarter for Lilacs and working with other campaigns, you may see Pigtails and your rewards much sooner than September!

The PIGTAILS STORY

Soo-jin Kang is 22 years old and preparing to take on a new role as a marketing representative for a makeup company looking to expand in the United States. However, she must leave all that's familiar in South Korea behind: her parents, friends, brother. It's a sad and stressful part of becoming an adult, but Soo-jin knows it's the best thing for her.

It takes three days after arriving in Chicago for her world to collapse. Soo-jin encounters Chin-hwa, an inspector who's traveled all the way from South Korea to tell Soo-jin her parents have been murdered. Although she promises the Inspector she'll remain a bystander, she doesn't have confidence Chin-hwa will succeed in finding out who killed her parents. Soo-jin is going to rely on her martial arts skills and her beauty to find the answers she wants.

The Main Cast

 

 

 

MEET THE TEAM!

I am a science fiction/fantasy/horror writer with publishing credits in Aphelion Webzine, Concisely, Dark Gothic Resurrected, Midwest Literary Review, The Fringe Magazine, and more. I have pieces in various anthologies, including Steampunk Anthology (story was nominated for an award), and Welcome to Hell, western-horror anthology edited by Eric S. Brown. Novels include Nightcry, The Golden Door, Horde, Indiscriminate, and My Only One. My latest novel, Grandmother, was released in December 2016 from Fear Front Publishing. I have 2 comic shorts appearing in 2 horror comic anthologies in summer and fall 2017. In April 2016, I ran a successful Kickstarter to fund my one-shot horror comic, Lilacs. I am currently a staff writer for Affinity Press, working on 4-issue action comic series.

Ming Wang is a graduate from the School of Visual Arts and currently lives in Brooklyn. He likes to read manga and watch anime when not drawing and somewhere finds the time to collect lots of Gundam model kits and Figma action figures.

 

                                       

Janet Lee was the artists for Image Comic's LOST VEGAS which Jim McCann wrote. This reunited the team responsible for the Eisner-Award-Winning graphic novel RETURN OF THE DAPPER MEN. Janet was also artist for Marvel's adaptations of the Jane Austen classics Emma and Northanger Abbey, as well as several anthologies.

 

NOW TO THE GOOD STUFF: REWARDS.

The list is big. Each reward tier grows a little bit bigger than the one before it. You have the opportunity to get books, comics, custom art, custom haikus and short stories, Pigtails branded merchandise, variant covers, and more! However, EVERYONE gets a hearty thank you in some form or another. 

Besides the digital and physical copies of Pigtails you can get, you'll also be able to get copies of my novels and ebooks! There is even on ebook written under a pen name...and it is a romance! I have also included my previous comic, Lilacs as an item in most of the reward options.

For the custom work, you will see two different kinds. Writing and art! The custom haikus and custom stores will be written by me, and can be about nearly anything you want. Stuck on an idea? I can also ask you questions and base the haiku or story from that! The art will either be sketch cards (about 2x3 size) or something larger (about 8x10). Note: for any of the custom work, you must keep it clean if you are presenting an idea.

The $300 reward has something VERY unique. If you want the original artwork for Janet Lee's Variant Cover, grab this tier! There is only 1 available!

Custom haikus will be written on sketch cards and mailed. Custom stories will be emailed to you as PDFs. For custom artwork, a digital copy will be emailed to you, but you'll also receive the original in the mail.

 Here's a quick rundown of the books: 

  • Nightcry: Grant returns to his hometown to run the local newspaper, but soon, bodies start to appear and all evidence points to Grant that he murdered them. So he must get people to believe it wasn't him, but someone or something else. 
  • The Golden Door: Each day for weeks, two boys, 14 and 9, watch their father paint a door in their house gold. The boys are told never to go in there. But one day they decide to open the door to find out the real reason their father is doing that. The truth had its price. 
  • Horde: Some things are worse than zombies. Horde is novella about five survivors escaping from a large group of zombies. After hearing the converted tornado siren and watching a mass exodus from the campground that has served as home for three months, Percy, Jack, Harry, Melody and Joann make a decision to move further into the state park to find solace from the undead. However, as they move deeper into the forest, a discovery awaits them that is more horrific than what is chasing them. About Horde 2: Greener Pastures, the sequel to Horde, continues the journey of a small group of survivors in a world overrun by zombies. In Horde 2, the survivors face a new threat, which forces them to return to the city that once was their home to seek out shelter and maybe a solution for the world.
  • My Only One: In the future, you're allowed to own one book. Only one book. When a man's daughter steals a second book, he scrambles to return it without getting caught. In doing so, he learns secrets of the dystopian world that could change how everyone lives. 
  • Indiscriminate: With only 300,000 people left in the world, twelve cybernetically-enhanced humans protect the world from violent creatures who are trying to infect the remaining population. 
  • Moderia: An epic horror poem about a man who plans to travel to an island he doesn't think exists. He finds it and learns the tales of monster and supernatural beings are true. 
  • The Tree: A old man has never had a Christmas tree, and his realtor decides to change that. If you like sugary, Hallmark Christmas stories, this one is right up your alley. 
  • Dial Tone: William has recently lost his wife and shows signs of becoming severely depressed. His friends talk him into going to a medium with the special ability to talk to the dead...not through her, but through a rotary-dial phone she has possessed for many years. Apprehensive and hopeful, William visits the medium and is thrown into a supernatural world beyond anything he could ever comprehend.
  • At the Lake (as Veronica Colbeck): Kari has suffered inconceivable blows to her personal and work life. So she decides to take some time away and go to Winter Lake, where she's been visiting every year with her father. For the past three years he's been unable to make it. Once at Winter Lake, Kari meets Fielding, a new resident who runs the tour around the lake. He manages to get her to go to dinner with him, and he tells a story about the area that no one knows. Followed up with a question that will perplex her about her future.
  • Underneath the Trees: A simple collection of poems that deal with love, despair, confusion...pretty much what poets have been writing about for years.
  • Lilacs: Max is ready for the next step in his life: a big promotion at work. Except on the day of his interview, he’s late and in a rush. A chance meeting with a lady selling flowers sets to change Max’s life forever. Lilacs is a tale of fate and decisions driven by seemingly harmless flowers. Lilacs: The flowers tell a different story.

WHERE'S THE MONEY GOING TO GO?

I appreciate you pledging your hard-earned dollars towards Pigtails. So you should know exactly where the funds are going, right? Having everything done makes it easy to tell you how much is going where. Most important is to make sure the artist and printing were top priorities. Rewards are important too, but I already have many rewards on hand. Then there’s the Kickstarter fee percentage. If you like graphs, then just look below:

Would like you guys to note that if you are U.S. based and pledging a tier that is ONLY getting a comic, shipping is free ($7-$15 tiers).

And to let everyone know, anything leftover will go towards making issue #2! If you have any questions about this project, don't hesitate to contact me.

projectTitle: Breast Cancer Mission Impossible
projectDescription:
BREAST CANCER: MISSION IMPOSSIBLE FOLLOWING WOMENS JOURNEYS THROUGH April 1, 2017 OVERVIEW

This project was started to follow my friends through their breast cancer journeys. All the women I am documenting are from the same location that I grew up in. I would like to shed light on the similarities of their cases and do some location research to see if there one or more factors related, and come to any conclusions of all the similarities to my friends’ cases. 1. Project Scope To interview six of my childhood friends involved in the cancer fight who are in parts of Pinellas County, Pasco County, and Hillsborough County Florida. To speak Moffitt Cancer Institute’s researchers and educate myself in medical knowledge that I may not have found or come up with on my own. To research the area, we grew up in and take soil samples and water samples from the current timeframe to compare it to time frames from the past. To look for environmental factors playing a role in the diagnosis of these woman and breast cancer specifically, triple negative and if the BRACA-1 genome mutation is a factor. 2. High-Level Requirements My high-level requirements will be sponsorship and project backing for our documentary. I will need water and soil sampling companies, as well as independent labs to test said samples. Things such as gas cards, airline points or miles will greatly help, as I am in Colorado and the documentary is focusing on a small part of Central Florida. I want people to know I am out there and I am fighting my way right along with other warriors. This is a completely independent venture I have taken on. Any support would be wonderful. My goal is to create this documentary to help find possible similarities in the cases of women we have on board while they are still on this earth fighting this illness. I have the family of Patti Dick joining me on this project. She is my childhood friend that lost her fight. She, as well as all our daughters, sisters, mothers and wives that may be effected by this horrendous illness deserve to know if in fact, this is somewhat attached to the environment.

All men and women with any type of Breast Cancer could be impacted. I need all the help I can get. Gas cards, airline miles, anything I can collect to raffle off and show that Colorado’s on our side with this fight. I will be going to Florida often to research and get interviews as we are following these ladies through their fight! I have now adopted this wonderful state as my home and we proud to have Colorado help in this venture. I now have a Moffitt Cancer Research doctor conducting interviews and an immense amount of research has been done to link these issues together. In closing, thank you for giving a few moments of your time for my journey.

Stephanie Balfrey Steph.bcmi@gmail.com Facebook group Breast Cancer Mission Impossible 813 484 3155

projectTitle: IMME Watches. Contemporary, Original and Timeless design.
projectDescription:
About us

IMME is an independent watchmaker with a team of Hong Kong based designers who are well-versed in the watch industry. We aim at providing our customers outstanding quality watches with affordable price tags.  

IMME = I’m me. Being original with a touch of unique style.

IMME is a brand dedicated to create lasting products through radically simplified aesthetics. We embrace passion with purpose, heavily influenced by urban styling and contemporary design. Balance, rhythm and proportion create a collection of simple, modern timepieces that are not only practical but also useful and beautiful.

Design detail

 

 

 

 

The first collection of modern automatic watches - OTTO delivers a contemporary timepiece, using urban street-style influences to deliver a beautiful, quality, versatile and affordable modern wristwatch.

We created a clean, smart and original timepiece that pays tribute to the classic watches, whilst adding a modern touch fit for any style or occasion.

The stainless steel case goes with scratch-resistant sapphire glass. The dial with cutout and case back with color pop glass and see through the movement mechanism. It featured the Japan-made precise 8S20 automatic movement.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Interchangeable strap construction

All watches are completed with interchangeable strap construction. It is an easy, friendly way for you to detach and attach the strap. Just slide the lever with finger on spring bar on the backside of watch. You can change your strap easily.

 

                                        

Product Specifications

Each timepiece is made of 316L stainless steel. Model 8003 and 8004 models have durable Ionic black plating. All go with scratch-resistant sapphire glass and has 5 ATM water resistances. Watch movement is the reliable Japan Citizen 8S20 automatic.

  • Case Material: 316L Stainless Steel
  • Dial: Fine sandblasted Silver white / Black / Gun Grey colour
  • Strap Material: Genuine Leather or Stainless Steel Mesh Band
  • Buckle: 316L Stainless Steel 
  • Glass: Scratch-resistant sapphire glass
  • Water Resistant: 5 ATM
  • Screw case back with coloured glass
  • Movement: Japan Citizen 8S20 automatic with 21 Jewels

 

 

Watch assembly and Water resistant test

 

 

 

Attractive price

We manage to keep the price of our watches very affordable by cutting off indirect costs of distributors and wholesalers. Our watch represents great value for money.

Why we need you:

We need your support to make our project successful. Everything is ready for commencement of production. Our manufacturing partners are just awaiting our go-ahead once we have orders on hand. By supporting us as a backer, you will be among the first to own IMME timepiece at deep discount!

projectTitle: Pinhole Pro: Professional Pinhole Lens For DSLR & SLR Camera
projectDescription:
A Professional Lens Without Glass: Introducing Pinhole Pro for DSLR and SLR Cameras

Thingyfy Pinhole Pro is an innovative update to DSLR pinhole photography. Pinhole photography has long held a vintage and DIY aesthetic, discounted by many perhaps because of the breakthroughs in optics since its creation. But there is still room for this simple, elegant implementation in contemporary photography. The pinhole lens embodies a foundational concept in photography- the camera obscura. The images it produces are distinct, and unique in nature. With so many options on the market, as well as the ability for anyone to build their own, why do we not see more of this photography in practice?

Pinhole Photography and Cinematography in the Digital Age

What’s missing is an innovation in technology to bring the user experience of modern digital cameras to this centuries old technique. Thingyfy Pinhole Pro makes a simple, small change- multiple pinholes, but that change allows for real-time experimentation and manipulation that just doesn't exist in any other model. The unique properties of pinhole photography need to be exposed and played with. New uses discovered. With the products currently available on the market, all one can do is demo the principal at hand. 

The aim for the Pinhole Pro is to make an aggressive attempt at re-introducing the viability and opportunity this lens affords to the professional and hobbyist photographers.

 

 

 

 

What Can Thingyfy Pinhole Pro Offer?

With Thingyfy Pinhole Pro photographers are able to:

  • Learn about camera obscura, photography fundamentals, light travel
  • Shoot digital or analogue still photos. get sharp, long exposures using the smallest pinholes being offered in the market
  • Shoot video. With medium to high ISO shoot at 30 or 60 FPS using the selection of large video pinholes
  • Shoot TimeLapse - authentic, long exposure time-lapse with durational motion blur
  • Experiment with Zone Plates - Chose to work with without depth of field using the pinholes, or switch to a zone plate for a fresnel soft focus at a fixed point. 
  • Zone plates let in more light and work well for video too.

How is Pinhole Pro Different from other Pinhole Lens?

Comparing the options of Pinhole Pro and what it offers the photographer, along with the ease of use switching between apertures - this lens brings a precision and quality that no other product currently offers. Combined with the aesthetic appeal of machined all metal components and tactile moving parts, this modern update brings the treasured aesthetic of pinhole photography into the contemporary landscape of new media.

We want to position Pinhole Pro at the intersection of two existing products: the Zero Optik 35mm Pinhole (Cost around $1500 USD with minimal functionality) and the Skink Pancake Pinhole (Lower end entry level lens cost around $50 USD). There's currently no other similar lens in the market that can allow users to switch between different apertures and sharpness in a single pinhole lens. 

 

Pinhole Pro Technical Specifications

Focal Length: 50mm 
Pinhole Sizes: 0.1mm, 0.15mm, 0.2mm, 0.25mm,0.3mm, 0.35mm, 0.5mm, 0.8mm
Lens Mount: EF, F, A
Threads: 58mm
Front Diameter: 68.5mm 
Total Depth (Including Front and Back Lens Caps): 50mm
Body: Anodized Aluminum Alloy 

Why Can We Make a High-End Lens with Low Cost? 

Thingyfy is a groundbreaking Maker 2.0 company that owns industrial robotics and CNC facilities. So we are able to prototype and produce high precision products at gaming changing speed, without the need of complicated and expensive tooling and moulding. This alone saves us hundreds of thousands of dollars in production cost.

Thingyfy Pinhole Pro is entirely built with aviation grade aluminium. This material ensures precision and durability, and light weight at the same time. We want to offer a precision designed lens with tactile moving parts - affording the feeling of mechanical complexity that is missing from fixed pinhole lenses. The added value in our design comes from engineering its accessible nature to meet the needs of the situation. Precision, materiality, weight and friction are all factors we can use to encourage this perception in our users. We also want to provide a kind of no-nonsense, complete solution for a DLSR pinhole lens. This lens will expose the user to core elements of photography and allow them to play. From seeing the effect of changing the aperture in real time to freelensing with hand-held optics. It's a great way to learn fundamentals, which doubles as a viable, high-resolution lens option for experienced photographers. 

Who is Thingyfy?

Thingyfy is a groundbreaking interactive platform that connects the global maker movement with next-generation manufacturing technologies. By bringing ideas to life at game-changing speed and scale, Thingyfy opens Industry 4.0 to the world’s creative minds. Production is now both intuitively accessible and incredibly affordable. Powered by 200+ state-of-the-art industrial robotic manufacturing facilities and a strong code of ethics, Thingyfy offers seamless integration at the intersection of change.

Where Are We at Right Now?

We have already completed the design and production prototypes of the Pinhole Pro for both Canon EOS-EF mount and Nikon F Mount. All testing is complete and we are ready to start the first batch of manufacturing. 

 

 

Why Do We Need Your Backing?

While Thingyfy provides state-of-the-art manufacturing services, we are actively incubating innovative ideas and designs. Pinhole Pro is one of the many great ideas that came from our internal innovation teams, that run each project as a  start-up company and need your help as Kickstarter to ensure their dreams can come true and their ideas can become successful products that will benefit pinhole photography lovers around the world. 

Where Will the Fund Be Used? 

We will be using the crowdfunded money to produce the first batch of products for all major DSLR and SLR camera models on the market, including Canon, Nikon, Minolta and SONY etc. 

We will also be using this fund to do further research and design and make this lens available for Micro 4/3 photographers.

What About Micro 3/4 Cameras? 

Currently, we have made Pinhole Pro available for all DSLR and SLR camera mounts. We are actively working on Micro 3/4 mounts and aiming to deliver Micro 3/4 mount Pinhole Pro lens by the end of 2017. 

What's the Retail Price of Pinhole Pro?

The future retail price of Pinhole Pro is set to be $179 USD. But we are offering the first batch of Pinhole Pro to Kickstarter at only $69 CAD (About $50 USD). 

A Lens Forever. 

Each lens has a unique serial number laser engraved on the body. Making it one and only.  

You also have the option to laser engrave your name on the lens for an extra $10 CAD.

projectTitle: FIREFLY | Glowing zipper pull, key chain, and more...
projectDescription:
Our team has spent years working with glow resins and improving their overall qualities for glow strength and longevity. We love to let our imaginations run wild with ways to use these resins in fun and functional ways. Creating the FireFly zipper pull was an idea that bounced around for a while in our minds. When we finally made prototypes and went on our first camping trip with them we were amazed at just how much everyone loved them and how functional they really were. We hope this product finds a place at campsites around the world and brings help and joy to all who use them.  

Meet FireFly!

 

 

 

We ultimately wanted the FireFly to be a simple product for adults and children alike. It had to be durable enough for an adult to put wear and tear on it and easy enough for a child to throw it on and off a zipper.  

After sampling all sorts of clasps and enclosures for attaching the glow resin bead and connecting to zippers and other object, we settled on paracord.

Paracord is a lightweight nylon kernmantle rope originally used in the suspension lines of parachutes. This cord is useful for many other tasks and is now used as a general purpose utility cord by both military personnel and civilians. This versatile cord was even used by astronauts during the 82nd Space Shuttle mission to repair the Hubble Space Telescope. 

The glowing bead on the firefly is a high grade high density glow powder infused Epoxy Resin bead. The way we produce the epoxy eliminates voids in the resin and is infused with an extremely high density of photo-luminescent powder so the glow is more vibrant and longer lasting than standard glow materials available on the market.

projectTitle: PROTO | a game to inspire innovators
projectDescription:
In PROTO, you are leading a new creative project, competing with other players to build the best business.

Using the cards as inspiration, players come up with ideas for a business and pitch how they want to use each card to attract more users.

PROTO is a card game about the business of dreams. Whether it's a new project inside your company or an entirely new start-up, we wanted to create a way to feel the excitement of the creative process in just 1 hour.

 


Transform Uncertainty into Serendipity

While most people fear innovation because of the uncertainty, PROTO gamifies the chaos of the creative process: the randomness of the cards, the roll of the dice, and the surprise attacks from other players.  This much is out of your hands, but what is always within your control are your skills: 

  • strategy, 
  • storytelling, 
  • and creativity.

The game provides a safe yet challenging opportunity to practice building an idea into a business, pitching to others, and imagining possibilities from any situation. Through PROTO, players cultivate the skills of innovation.

 

How to play PROTO

From randomly drawn cards, players come up with ideas to pitch, and get feedback in the form of dice rolls. So the more others like their ideas, the more rolls they get.

Based on this feedback, players move along the "Impact Line" to see how many users they're influencing.

Players can also attack each other with challenges, as well as strategically plan the innovation cards they use.

The winner is the first player to complete the 5 stages of the Impact line!

  • Concept 
  • Local start-up 
  • Small biz 
  • National business 
  • World-class brand

 

Countless practical applications

Throughout the development process, our testers suggested many different scenarios for where they wanted to use PROTO:

  • client consulting meetings, 
  • MBA case-study analysis, 
  • business model development, 
  • client-pitch brainstorming, 
  • team-building events, 
  • pitch competitions,
  • a way to match start-up co-founders, 
  • strategy road-mapping,
  • and even a tool for investment applications.

 

What's inside the box?

  • USER Cards (20x)
    At the center of every successful business are its users and we've brainstormed unique demographics for you.
  • FEATURE Cards (30x)
    Most basically, features are what you sell: either a product or service. You'll need both emerging tech and the most basic fundamentals.
  • BOOSTER Cards (30x)
    Having analyzed hundreds of businesses, we found key catalysts that help businesses grow.
  • CHALLENGE Cards (30x)
    We interviewed entrepreneurs to find the juiciest obstacles they've ever faced to prepare you for all the crazy difficulties of innovation.
  • Sand-timer
    Everyone needs a deadline and in PROTO, you have 1 minute 
  • Impact Line
    From "Concept" to "World Class Brand" the impact line measures how many users you're able to influence (5 cards)
  • Dice
    The dice function as a voting system for your pitches, delicately balancing luck and skill
  • Player Icons
    4 simple, geometric icons will help indicate who is in the lead on the Impact Line.

Printing: Standard poker sized cards will be printed on high-quality thick paper, with a matte finish that's easy on the eyes. 

  • Dimensions: 2.5" x 3.5"
    (with 1/8th" rounded corners, not pictured)
  • Paper: 300 gsm
  • Finish: double sided color, matte finish
  • Number of cards: 120 (including 5 extra blank cards)

  

 

Details of each set

  • Cards: 120 in each set 
  • Players: 1 - 4 people 
  • Age: 18 + 
  • Play time:
     - 20-30 mins (for quick-play rules)
     - 60 minutes (for standard game rules)
     - 2-3 hours (for workshop usage) 
  • Type: storytelling + imagination + strategy

A Very Special Game

  • Social Innovation - We intentionally included seniors, immigrants and females (amongst others) into our USER cards so to gently nudge players to develop for under-served communities.

  • Accessible Innovation - The simple, clear explanations of new technologies allow tech newbies to understand and engage with innovation

  • Attack or Aid? - As players can both attack and give feedback, the path to success isn't defined and through playing PROTO, players discover their own strategy (hint: it's good to be a nice guy).

  • Business is Beautiful - Every single card has its own unique infographic that simply illustrates complex ideas into beautiful minimal geometric forms.

  • Complete Creativity - PROTO cards are merely the building blocks designed to inspire your imagination.  Build any business you dream!

Plainly put, PROTO is a conversation starter.  We simply hope it inspires you to start talking about your dreams, start getting feedback, and eventually start changing lives through innovation.

 

 

 

 

 

About the Creators

PROTO was co-developed by the creative community in Shanghai, China. From challenge to concept, prototype to polishing, and mechanics to aesthetics, every detail was informed by the community through hundreds of iterations.  This process was led by Let's Make Great! a consultancy founded by 3x TEDx speaker, Brian Tam and offers creative workshops, innovation consulting and other organizational growth services.

After this long development process, we're excited to share PROTO with the Kickstarter community!
